1.text: Now there was one of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a leader of the Jews.

2.text: He came to Jesus by night, and said, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher who has come from God because no one can perform the signs which you accomplish unless God is with him.”

3.text: Jesus answered him, “Amen, amen, I tell you; unless one is born anew, he cannot see the Kingdom of God.”

4.text: Nicodemus asked him, “How can someone who is old be born? Can one enter a second time into his mother’s womb, and be born [anew]?”

5.text: Jesus answered, “Amen, amen, I tell you; unless one is born of water and spirit, he cannot enter into the Kingdom of God!

6.text: What is born of the flesh is flesh. What is born of the Spirit is spirit.

7.text: Do not marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born anew.’

8.text: The wind blows where it wants to, and you hear its sound, but do not know where it comes from and where it is going. So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit.”

10.text: Jesus replied and said, “You are the teacher of Israel and do not understand these things?

11.text: Amen, amen, I tell you; we speak of what we know, and [we] bear witness to what we have seen, and you do not receive our testimony.

12.text: If I told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you [about] heavenly things?

13.text: No one has ascended into heaven, except for the one who came down out of heaven, the Son of Man who is in heaven.

14.text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, likewise, the Son of Man must be lifted up,

15.text: so that everyone believing in him should not perish but have eternal life.

16.text: Indeed, God so loved the world that he gave his uniquely-begotten Son, so that everyone who believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.

17.text: Certainly, God did not send his Son into the world to judge the world, but so that the world should be saved through him.

18.text: Anyone who believes in him is not judged, but whoever does not believe has already been judged, because such a person has not believed in the Name of the only-begotten Son of God.

19.text: This is the judgment: that the light has come into the world, and people have loved the darkness rather than the light, because their deeds were evil.

20.text: For everyone who practices evil hates the light and does not come to the light, for fear that his works would be exposed.

21.text: But whoever practices the truth comes to the light, so that his works may be revealed as done in God.”

22.text: After these things, Jesus came with his disciples into the land of Judea. He stayed there with them, and baptized.

23.text: John also was baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because there was much water there, and people came, and [they] were baptized.

24.text: (For John had not yet been thrown into prison).

25.text: Now a discussion arose on the part of John’s disciples with a [certain] Jew about ceremonial washing.

26.text: They came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, he who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you bore witness, behold, this one is [now] baptizing, and everyone is coming to him!”

27.text: John answered, “No one can receive anything unless it has been given to him from heaven.

28.text: You yourselves testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before him.’

29.text: He who has the bride is the bridegroom, but the friend of the bridegroom who stands [by] and hears him rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. And so my joy is fulfilled.

30.text: He must increase, but I must decrease.”

31.text: He who comes from above is above all. He who is from the earth belongs to the earth, and he speaks from the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.

32.text: And what he has seen and heard is what he bears witness to, but no one accepts his testimony.

33.text: He who has accepted his testimony has set his seal [to this], that God is true.

34.text: Indeed the one whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God gives the Spirit without measure.

35.text: The Father loves the Son and has given all things into his hand.

36.text: The one who believes in the Son has eternal life, but whoever does not believe in the Son will not see life; instead, the wrath of God remains on such a person.
